brand_info.name: Netflix
brand_info.positioning: A global subscription streaming service that delivers films, series, and entertainment experiences across devices, designed for instant access and personalized discovery.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in 1997 in Scotts Valley, California by Reed Hastings and Marc Randolph, first operating as a DVD-by-mail movie rental business before expanding into streaming in 2007.

brand_values.brand_promise: A vast, always-on entertainment library with frictionless access and a strong sense of discovery, powered by originals and global storytelling.

psychographics.lifestyle: On-demand entertainment seekers across home and mobile contexts, ranging from casual viewers to deep fandom communities
psychographics.behavior: Binge or episodic viewing, frequent genre switching, driven by recommendations, social conversation, and cultural moments.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Short, punchy statements with cultural immediacy; copy behaves like a trailer card or UI microcopy.
tone_dos: Let the title and imagery do the heavy lifting

logo.primary_logo: Netflix wordmark (arched) and the standalone 'N' monogram used for compact placements
logo.usage_rules: Prefer Netflix Red on black; use black or white only when necessary for clarity; keep clear space and never distort, rotate, or add effects.
logo.lockup_behavior: Wordmark typically top-centered or top-left in campaigns; 'N' monogram used as a corner bug in UI-led layouts.
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals at least the width of the 'N' stem around the mark.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Black dominates; Netflix Red is the primary accent for brand anchors and key words; white is reserved for legibility and UI-like copy.

typography.secondary_font: System sans-serif for UI compatibility when needed

spacing.line_height: Compact for headlines, comfortable for supporting copy

hierarchy: H1 – Bold all caps or strong title case

layout_principles.grid_system: Simple poster grid with strong central axis; scalable for OOH, digital, and UI-derived compositions
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: High negative space with a single hero focal point
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-led with typographic headline as the second anchor
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third or centered button-style when mimicking UI behavior
layout_principles.alignment: Centered, high-contrast, with clear top and bottom bands for brand and message

style.camera_feel: Trailer-grade stills and key art that read instantly at distance, with strong silhouette and clear emotional cue.
style.pose_guidelines: Emotional clarity over fashion posing; either iconic stillness (portrait) or frozen peak-action (scene moment).
style.casting_attitude: Character-driven presence; expressive but readable; authenticity tied to the story world.

technical.lighting: High-contrast cinematic key with controlled falloff; occasional spotlight or vignette to isolate the hero
technical.grain: Minimal to subtle film grain depending on title
technical.depth_of_field: Moderate separation; sharp hero with controlled background softness
technical.color_grading: Deep blacks with controlled highlights; red accents used for brand linkage or narrative tension

contexts: Conceptual props that symbolize binge culture

model_casting.diversity: Global and inclusive across regions and cultures

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Brand mark is a strong anchor; content imagery is the hero; product experience appears via UI cues when relevant
product_presentation.styling_approach: Title-authentic wardrobe and props; minimal extra styling; prioritize recognizability

motion_rules.pacing: Trailer logic: quick hook, strong beat, clean end card
motion_rules.transitions: Hard cuts, smash cuts, clean fades to black, and title-card typography beats

visual_dos: Use deep blacks and a single dominant accent
Anchor the layout with the wordmark or N bug
Use cinematic lighting and clear silhouettes
copy_dos: Let the story lead the message

test_zone: Playful UI remixes and cultural stunts

interactive_elements: Trailer pods and sound-isolated viewing corners
retail.soundscape: Trailer audio beats, theme cues, and controlled ambient low end

digital.tone_adjustment: UI-forward and concise; headline-first; motion previews and strong end cards

platform_behavior.Instagram: Bold typographic hooks over cinematic frames; short trailer loops; clean end cards
platform_behavior.Website: Black canvas, minimal UI, clear red highlights, fast path to play
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Title-led modules, minimal copy, strong thumbnails, clear watch intent

print.paper: Matte or satin stock with rich black reproduction
print.cover_rules: Large title frame or key art, minimal copy, red wordmark as the primary brand anchor

logo_misuse_examples: Adding shadows or glows to the logo
Placing the mark on low-contrast backgrounds
